entry.title: Combined summary - Crossing the line? [Was: Re: Let's deploy BIP65 CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY!]
entry.summary: The Bitcoin development community recently engaged in a debate about the origin of the term "simplified payment verification" (SPV). Mike Hearn claimed responsibility for coining the term, which he implemented in bitcoinj and BreadWallet. However, some members of the community accused him of making false statements and attempting to harm and divide the community through his actions, such as the contentious Bitcoin XT fork.There was a discussion about whether or not Hearn should be expelled from the Bitcoin-devs mailing list. The email writer expressed concern about disruptive behavior within the community list and suggested temporal bans based on circumstances rather than focusing on specific personalities. They also raised the issue of a post made by Mike Hearn containing false and damaging statements about Bitcoin, questioning whether Hearn has crossed a line that would result in expulsion from the community.Additionally, Hearn claimed to be Satoshi, the anonymous creator of Bitcoin, which further added to the controversy. The ongoing discussion on Reddit has led to the suggestion of a cooling-off period before any further action is taken, as there is no consensus on whether Hearn has crossed the line in terms of his posting and actions.The discussion surrounding SPV clients also touched on terminology, with "client only mode" and "headers only client" being used before the term "SPV wallet" became more widely adopted. It was suggested that eventually, SPV clients should be able to detect any rule violation on the blockchain.The email writer expressed concern about the noise level and drama within the community list, suggesting that a cooling-off period may help ease tensions. There was no consensus on whether Hearn's behavior warranted expulsion from the community, and the writer urged caution before taking any further action.
